1.title: Two more cis Black women banned from Olympics for their natural testosterone levels

2.title: Justice for the Murder of Rayshard Brooks
2.subtitle: Rayshard Brooks, an unarmed, 27 year old Black man was murdered after 3 officers responded to complaints of him sleeping in his vehicle in the Wendy’s parking lot. After struggling with the officers, Brooks began to run for his life, when he was shot in the back more than once.

3.title: Mutt's Sauce
3.subtitle: In 1956, Mutt got the idea to make a sauce he could use for every meal. Mutt’s sauce was a multi-purpose specialty sauce, infusing sweet, tangy and a little bit of heat into each spoonful.

products.name: Combo 3 Pack
products.description: BEST VALUE! Try all three: Original, Sweet N Spicy, Ghost Pepper

3.title: Toni Morrison - Biography
3.subtitle: Toni Morrison was a Nobel and Pulitzer Prize-winning American novelist. Among her best-known novels are "The Bluest Eye," "Song of Solomon," "Beloved," and "A Mercy."

4.title: Enough is Enough! Fire the Cops Who Killed Daunte Wright
4.subtitle: Here’s what we know: Police officers in Brooklyn Center, a Minneapolis suburb, shot and killed Daunte Wright during a traffic stop on Sunday, April 11. An unnamed police officer shot a gun into Daunte’s car, and his car then hit another vehicle. A passenger in Daunte’s care was injured, and Daunte was pronounced dead at the scene.

4.title: Diarrablu
4.subtitle: The Diarrablu mission is to iterate for sustainability while highlighting the African continent’s rich colors and unique patterns through practical and versatile pieces designed using mathematical concepts or algorithms.

products.name: Sustainable Mailys Dress - Noir
products.description: Sustainable, artisanal and size inclusive, the Mailys Dress is easily convertible into over 19 different styles. This garment is a comfortable and versatile dress thoughtfully designed to fit all body shapes and sizes.

products.name: Headwrap - Suto
products.description: These statement pieces are part of our zero-waste sustainable approach as we believe in maximizing the usage of all our fabrics.

products.name: Hidden in Ocho Rios | Art Print
products.description: In this piece, we daydream of an impromptu retreat in Ocho Rios, Jamaica in a hidden tree-house covered in palm leaves.

5.title: Support our Young Protest Leaders #freetianna
5.subtitle: On Tuesday, July 21, Tianna Arata was arrested by San Luis Obispo PD at about 8 p.m. near Mitchell Park as she and other demonstrators were loading up a car after the protest had already dispersed.

5.title: Ujamaa Lighting
5.subtitle: Although light bulbs are considered a commodity, the Ujamaa Lighting brand aspires to bring its own unique take on the lighting industry. Founded in June 2019, Ujamaa Lighting, specializes residential, commercial, and industrial LED lighting solutions.

products.name: Ujamaa Smart LED Light Bulb
products.description: Our customers spoke, and we listened!  Ujamaa Lighting is proud to introduce our version of the Smart Light.

products.name: #BLACKOUT T-Shirt
products.description: The #BLACKOUT movement was organized to bring awareness to police brutality and racism towards the African-American people. This t-shirt was designed in honor of the efforts to bring peace and equality to Black people worldwide.

products.name: Ujamaa Lighting Heavy Hoodie
products.description: Everyone needs a cozy go-to hoodie to curl up in, so go for one that's soft, smooth, and stylish. Our Ujamaa Lighting hoodie is the perfect choice for cooler evenings!

6.title: Liberation Library
6.subtitle: Young people in the jails and prisons we serve are experiencing a loss of programming and in-person family visits, leading to further isolation during these uncertain times. We believe it is now more important than ever for incarcerated young people to have access to other worlds of their choosing.

6.title: Constance Baker Motley: Judiciary’s Unsung Rights Hero
6.subtitle: Constance Baker Motley was an unlikely civil rights hero. An African American who grew up near Yale University, she did not personally experience overt racism until late in high school, and as a young person she was almost totally unaware of black history.

7.title: Adwoa Beauty
7.subtitle: Adwoa beauty is a modern, non toxic, gender neutral beauty brand catering to multi-cultural hair textures. Buying hair products is a choice, not a command. We empathize with your experience in using tons of products that failed to deliver the results. We've created a highly effective collection of products with ingredients that are concentrated, working with nature and science to bring you immediate results. We are committed to being transparent with our ingredients.

products.name: baomint moisturizing curl defining cream

7.title: What If I Don't Move to the Back of the Bus?
7.subtitle: Rosa Parks brought together a unique blend of life experiences, a commitment to racial justice, and a flawless reputation to transform a single act of defiance into a defining moment for the modern American civil rights movement.

8.title: Can the Beauty Industry Confront Colorism?
8.subtitle: The beauty industry has been trying to productively confront racism. Can it do the same with colorism, where lighter-skinned models are favored over those with darker skin?

8.title: Loza Tam
8.subtitle: Shop our collection of women's African Head Wraps. All of our head wraps & turbans are lined in satin to protect the hair against frizz, breakage and moisture loss.

products.name: Black Satin Head Wrap
products.description: Black, Pre-tied Satin Turban Head Wrap is made completely of black satin to prevent friction between the cotton fabric and your fragile hair strands. Features an elastic band in the back to ensure a the turban stays secure on your head.

products.name: Tema Turban Headband
products.description: Black, white and red turban headband is lined in black satin to prevent friction between the cotton fabric and your fragile hair strands.  Perfect to wear on your next Peloton ride or wear it casually on your next Zoom meeting with a messy bun. The headband features an elastic band in the back to accommodate various head sizes.

products.name: Luchi Yellow Satin-Lined Headband

9.title: Dynamic Confluence
9.subtitle: I have items that I carry with me anywhere I go in case of an emergency. I couldn't find an emergency kit that was complete, so I made a few of my own. I hope people will find these items useful. It's better to have and not need, than need and not have.

9.title: 13th Amendment
9.subtitle: The 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, ratified in 1865 in the aftermath of the Civil War, abolished slavery in the United States.

10.title: Whistling Vivaldi
10.subtitle: Claude M. Steele, who has been called "one of the few great social psychologists," offers a vivid first-person account of the research that supports his groundbreaking conclusions on stereotypes and identity.

10.title: National Bail Out
10.subtitle: National Bail Out is a Black-led and Black-centered collective of abolitionist organizers, lawyers and activists building a community-based movement to support our folks and end systems of pretrial detention and ultimately mass incarceration. We are people who have been impacted by cages — either by being in them ourselves or witnessing our families and loved ones be encaged. We are queer, trans, young, elder, and immigrant.

11.title: Ashay by the Bay
11.subtitle: We are an Independent Minority Owned Business and Deborah Day is the Founder and CEO. She opened the business in 2000 and started selling books online in 2002, establishing Ashay by the Bay as a Book Reseller that Specializes in African American and Multi-Cultural Children’s Books, Baby-3 and K-12 for Schools and Organizations.  We sell a Diverse Selection of books to both the Consumer and Business Markets and we Build Custom Collections for School and Classroom Libraries.  We also sell Gift Cards provide and we are the publishers of the Mindful Messages Curriculum.  Our home office is located in Vallejo, California. and we sell books throughout the US, Canada and select Markets around the world.

11.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
11.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

12.title: Ban or Restrict Tear Gas
12.subtitle: The use of tear gas has been banned and is illegal in war. This same tear gas is used by the law enforcement, to control unarmed crowds protesting for the BLM movement. Tear gas is also used for border control and is thrown at innocent migrants who are unarmed and pose no sudden threat to anyone in the vicinity.

12.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
12.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

13.title: 1619 Podcast
13.subtitle: An audio series from The Times observing the 400th anniversary of the beginning of American slavery.

13.subtitle: Change lives today. Donate now to support incarcerated and formerly incarcerated youths and adults.

16.subtitle: The Sentencing Project compiles state-level criminal justice data from a variety of sources. Using this state-by-state data feature, you can navigate between interactive maps, tables, and rankings that allow you to access and use these data.

17.title: How to Be an Antiracist
17.subtitle: Ibram X. Kendi's concept of antiracism reenergizes and reshapes the conversation about racial justice in America—but even more fundamentally, points us toward liberating new ways of thinking about ourselves and each other.

18.title: Afro Flow Yoga
18.subtitle:
With over 14 years of experience, Leslie Salmon Jones continues to pursue an active interdisciplinary career in health and dance in Boston and New York City. A Toronto native, Leslie received her B.A. in Dance and Health Studies at the State University of New York, and her Fitness Instructors Certification at New York University. She was a scholarship recipient at the esteemed Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre in New York City as well as the London Contemporary Dance School.

As a professional dancer, Leslie worked with known greats such as Judith Jameson, Bill T. Jones and Wynton Marsalis. At her studio in New York, she developed her own exercise program based on various techniques honed through working with her personal training clientele on a daily basis. Today she continues to divide her time between New York City and Boston.

Leslie has extensive experience in the fitness industry, including being a consultant for the New York Knicks healthy lifestyle clinic that teaches self-esteem to youth. She also served as a board member for the organization, Free Arts for Abused Kids, NYC. Today, she serves as a board member of the United Nations Association of New York

19.title: Shades of My Melanin LLC
19.subtitle: At Shades of My Melanin, our goal is to not only offer products that make you feel beautiful in your own skin but to offer products that tell a story for each and every person who wears them. We offer fun, colorful, and creative products that can be worn by all ages.

19.title: 360 Magazine
19.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

20.title: Sports Can Battle Racism Workshop
20.subtitle: A workshop for coaches on how to ensure that sports is an inclusive environment for ALL athletes.
20.moreInfo: In this 90 minute workshop, coaches will have an interactive discussion on how to combat racial discrimination, champion moral courage and empower their programs to create positive change in their communities.

20.title: Colorism in the Beauty Industry
20.subtitle: America has progressed tremendously over recent years in terms of racial inequality, but colorism remains to be seen on a global scale.

21.title: Grace X Originals LLC
21.subtitle: Grace X Originals is a "Slow Fashion" Streetwear & Lifestyle Brand. We take our time to expertly hand-dye our textiles and apply high-end airbrush artistry to our designs with sustainable fashion practices foremost in mind.

21.title: #JusticeforBre: Police officers who killed Breonna Taylor must be FIRED.
21.subtitle: Call for the three police officers responsible for the death of Breonna Taylor to be fired and charged for murder.

22.title: Princess Planet
22.subtitle: Princess Planet is a brand of children's entertainment that helps promote characters with diverse hair textures, skin tones, and cultural backgrounds.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 1
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume One is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

products.name: An Octet of Odes – Volume 2
products.description: An Octet of Odes Volume Two is a compilation of poems that premiers eight unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun.

products.name: Princess Planet: Coloring book
products.description: The Princess Planet Coloring Book showcases sixteen unique characters from Princess Planet. Each character is imagined with both magic and realism. They are created in a world that is as scientific as it is colorful, adventurous, and fun. All of the princesses’ stories are rooted in the realities of geography and history. They all reflect a love of learning and an appreciation for language, diversity, and culture.

22.title: White Fragility: Why It's So Hard for White People to Talk About Racism
22.subtitle: This book explicates the dynamics of White Fragility and how we might build our capacity in the on-going work towards racial justice.

23.title: Very Puzzled
23.subtitle: As a parent it can be quite challenging to find items such as books and toys that are representative of the diverse society that we live in.  It is important that children see other people that look different to themselves in the books and toys that they interact with to ensure that they appreciate their own heritage and respect the heritage and culture of others.

products.name: 100 piece Africa Map Giant Jigsaw Puzzle
products.description: Puzzles are really great way for you and your extended family to bond with a child.  The very puzzled Africa Map Puzzle is definitely something that you can get stuck into that is rewarding with 100 pieces and each country on the continent of Africa is represented with a variety of landmarks, monuments and attractions it will provide endless fun and topics of discussion that can be used as fun way to learn for both children and adults.

products.name: Ethiopia colour-in t-shirt
products.description: The Ethiopia colour-in t-shirt makes perfect gift for any child with a creative edge or a group activity for parties or play dates.⁠

products.name: Ghana Map Poster
products.description: The Very Puzzled Ghana map poster is an A2 poster that accurately reflects the map of Ghana each region of Ghana is represented with a variety of landmarks, monuments and attractions it will provide endless fun and topics of discussion that can be used as fun way to learn for both children and adults.

23.title: How we're priming some kids for college — and others for prison
23.subtitle: In the United States, two institutions guide teenagers on the journey to adulthood: college and prison. Sociologist Alice Goffman spent six years in a troubled Philadelphia neighborhood and saw first-hand how teenagers of African-American and Latino backgrounds are funneled down the path to prison — sometimes starting with relatively minor infractions. In an impassioned talk she asks, "Why are we offering only handcuffs and jail time?"

24.title: 210 Teas
24.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

24.title: Justice for Jacob Blake
24.subtitle: Jacob Blake is a loving father of 6 that deserves proper medical attention and legal representation. The funds raised through this Gofundme will go toward Jacob’s medical bills, family expenses, legal representation, support for his children and therapy costs.

25.title: Covid-19’s Impact on People in Prison
25.subtitle: People who are incarcerated are at great risk of sickness and death as a result of the Covid-19 pandemic and more must be done to release people who are imprisoned and are not a threat to public safety or are elderly or infirm.

products.name: Super-Gro Haridress
products.description: Apply to scalp and temples for thinning hair to promote optimal hair growth. It tingles promoting circulation and healthy hair. Contains Shea Butter, Horse Tail, Menthol and Chamomile. Dry, Itchy, Flaky scalp is a thing of the past.

products.name: Leave-In Detangling Conditioner

products.name: KURL POP Curl Hydration

26.title: The Honey Wine Company

products.name: Brut 750ml Honey Wine
products.description: The world standard for premium dry honey wine. Barrel aged in 100% French oak. Crisp, dry, and complex but with no bitter tannins.  Imbibers who enjoy drier cocktails or cider, pilsner style beers, and a variety of grape wine will appreciate versatile "Brut."

products.name: Demi Sec Sparkling 750ml Honey Wine

products.name: Wancha (Grape Wine) 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon 750ml

27.title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
27.subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

products.name: Beard Balms

29.title: American Civil Liberties Union

30.title: The Legacy of Malcom X
30.subtitle: This podcast series about Malcom X El-Hajj Malik El-Shabazz brings together scholars from a variety of fields and is an invitation to connect our ideas, research projects, and activism across disciplinary divides.

30.title: Classify White Supremacist Groups as Domestic Terrorist Organizations
30.subtitle: Request a new legal requirement to register, classify, and subsequently surveil white supremacist organizations as domestic terrorist organizations. By classifying these groups as intimidating to the American population and dangerous to human life, the institutions responsible for protecting citizens against such groups will have the necessary information and resources to prevent further destruction carried out by these violent terrorist groups.

31.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
31.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.

31.title: When the first all-black professional basketball team dominated...back in the ’20s
31.subtitle: "They were literally pioneers and recognized that they were making a statement in front of the audiences."
